overview.heading: Overview
overview.content: Geta WaterBill is a utility management application specifically designed for landlords and property managers. It streamlines the process of tracking water consumption and generating bills for tenants.

challenge.heading: The Challenge
challenge.intro: The main challenge was to create a utility-focused application that is extremely simple to use yet powerful enough to manage multiple properties and billing cycles accurately.
keyPoints: Eliminating manual calculation errors in utility billing
Providing a clear overview of consumption across multiple properties
Generating professional PDF or digital bills for tenants
Building a mobile-friendly interface for meter readings on the go

solution.heading: The Solution
solution.intro: I built a frontend-heavy application using Tailwind CSS for rapid styling and jQuery for handling dynamic billing calculations and UI updates.

approaches.title: Utility-First Design
approaches.description: Used Tailwind CSS to build a clean, functional interface that prioritizes data entry and readability.

approaches.title: Dynamic Calculations
approaches.description: Implemented real-time billing calculations using jQuery to provide immediate feedback during meter data entry.

process.heading: Process
process.intro: Focused on creating a smooth data entry flow for meter readers and a clear reporting dashboard for property managers.

steps.title: User Flow Mapping
steps.description: Interviewing potential users to understand the current manual billing process and its pain points.

steps.title: UI Prototyping
steps.description: Designing high-fidelity mockups focusing on numerical clarity and ease of navigation.

steps.title: Calculation Engine
steps.description: Developing the core logic to handle complex tiered water billing structures.

results.heading: Results
results.intro: Property managers using Geta WaterBill have reported significantly reduced billing times and improved accuracy.

metrics.label: Reduction in monthly billing administrative time
